config.script:
rootPath = self.view.params.config.rootPath
	docId = self.view.params.config.docId
	method = 'getResource'
	
	selected = self.getSibling("SheetNameDropdown").props.value
	options = self.getSibling("SheetNameDropdown").props.options
	
	selectedIdx = 0
	for idx, opt in enumerate(options):
		if opt.get("value") == selected:
			selectedIdx = idx
			break

	params = {"sheetIdx": selectedIdx}
	payload = {"rootPath":rootPath, "docId":docId, "method":method, "params": params}
	scope = 'page'
	self.view.custom.docUpdated = False
	system.perspective.sendMessage('tryMethod', payload, scope)

root = self.parent
	
	rootPath = self.view.params.config.rootPath
	docId = self.view.params.config.docId
	method = 'getSheet'
	
	counterIdx = 0
	while not self.view.custom.docUpdated:
		root.intervalCountUp(self.view.custom.counters[counterIdx], counterIdx)
		if self.view.custom.counters[counterIdx] >= 1000:
			system.perspective.print("getResource TimeOut.")
			break
	self.view.custom.counters[counterIdx] = 0
	if self.view.custom.docUpdated:
		selectedSheetName = self.getSibling("SheetNameDropdown").props.value
		sheetName = selectedSheetName if selectedSheetName else self.view.custom.docData.sheets[0].properties.title
		params = {
				"rowAsHeader":self.getSibling("HeaderCheckbox").props.selected,
				"sheetName":sheetName,
				"headerRowIndex":1, 
				"startRow":2,
				"endRow":None
				}
		payload = {"rootPath":rootPath, "docId":docId, "method":method, "params":params}
		scope = 'page'
		self.view.custom.sheetUpdated = False
		system.perspective.sendMessage('tryMethod', payload, scope)
	else:
		system.perspective.print("getResource Faulted")

customMethods.name: getAuth
getSheets
customMethods.script:
from google.google_sheets import GoogleSheetsClient
	
	if rootPath and docId:
		# Sheets Client Instance
		sheets = GoogleSheetsClient(rootPath, docId)
	else:
		sheets = self.getDefaultDocData()
	return sheets

customMethods.name: __init__
customMethods.script:
if docId and rootPath:
		self.view.custom.sheetData = ''
		self.view.custom.docUpdated = False
		self.view.custom.sheetUpdated = False
		system.perspective.sendMessage('tryMethod', payload = {"rootPath":rootPath, "docId":docId, "method":'getResource', "params":{"sheetIdx":sheetIdx}}, scope = 'page')

		counterIdx = 0
		while not self.view.custom.docUpdated:
			self.intervalCountUp(self.view.custom.counters[counterIdx], counterIdx)
			if self.view.custom.counters[counterIdx] >= 1000:
				system.perspective.print("getResource TimeOut.")
				break
		self.view.custom.counters[counterIdx] = 0
	
		getSheetParams = {
						"rowAsHeader":rowAsHeader,
						"sheetName":self.view.custom.docData.sheets[sheetIdx].properties.title, 
						"headerRowIndex":1, 
						"startRow":2, 
						"endRow":None
						}
		system.perspective.sendMessage('tryMethod', payload = {"rootPath":rootPath, "docId":docId, "method":'getSheet', "params":getSheetParams}, scope = 'page')
	else:
		self.view.custom.sheetData = ''
		self.view.custom.docUpdated = True
		self.view.custom.sheetUpdated = True
		system.perspective.sendMessage('tryMethod', payload = {"rootPath":rootPath, "docId":docId, "method":'getResource', "params":{}}, scope = 'page')

customMethods.name: intervalCountUp
customMethods.script:
from threading import Timer
	
	def countUp(counter, counterIdx):
		counter += 1
		self.view.custom.counters[counterIdx] = counter
	
	Timer(0.1, countUp, [counter, counterIdx]).start()

customMethods.name: getResource
getSheet
customMethods.script:
# Create GoogleSheetsClient
	sheets = self.getSheets(rootPath, docId)
	
	if rowAsHeader:

		# Produce: [{header1:val, header2:val, ...}, {...}, ...]
		return sheets.get_dict_rows(
			sheetName,
			headerRowIndex,
			startRow,
			endRow
		)

	# --------------------------------------------------------------
	# 2B) Mode 2: Raw grid data (A,B,C,...)
	# --------------------------------------------------------------
	else:
		# If user did not specify endRow, limit to 702 columns (A–ZZ)
		endRow = 702 if not endRow else endRow

		range_a1 = u"%s!A%d:ZZ%d" % (sheetName, headerRowIndex, endRow)

		# get_rows returns: [{"A":..., "B":..., ...}, {...}, ...]
		return sheets.get_rows(range_a1)

customMethods.name: getDefaultTableColumn

messageHandlers.script:
"""
	This handler is triggered when a Perspective Message is received
	(from system.perspective.sendMessage).

	The message payload contains:
	    - rootPath : Path to the Google UDT instance
	    - method   : Which Sheet method to execute ("getResource", "getSheet", "append", "update", "clear")
	    - docId    : Google Spreadsheet ID
	    - params   : Additional arguments for each operation

	This function:
	    1. Determines which operation is requested
	    2. Obtains the appropriate Google authentication object
	    3. Calls Google Sheets helper functions
	    4. Updates Perspective Table / Dropdown components
	    5. Signals completion via view.custom.docUpdated / sheetUpdated
	"""

	rootPath   = payload.get("rootPath", None)
	methodType = payload.get("method", None)
	docId      = payload.get("docId", '')
	params     = payload.get("params", '')

	try:
		# ----------------------------------------------------------------------
		#  Validate required fields (rootPath + docId)
		# ----------------------------------------------------------------------
		if rootPath and docId:
			# Perspective Table reference shortcut
			table  = self.getChild("Table")

			# ==================================================================
			# 1) getResource: Load spreadsheet metadata (sheet list, titles, etc.)
			# ==================================================================
			if methodType == 'getResource':
				self.view.custom.docData = self.getResource(rootPath, docId)
				
				rows = params.get("sheetIdx", 0)
				
				# Which sheet to display initially
				sheetIdx = rows

				# Update dropdown with sheet name
				self.getChild("SheetNameDropdown").props.value = \
					self.view.custom.docData.sheets[sheetIdx].properties.title

				# Signal to UI that spreadsheet metadata is loaded
				self.view.custom.docUpdated = True

			# ==================================================================
			# 2) getSheet: Fetch sheet values (as raw rows OR dict rows)
			# ==================================================================
			elif methodType == 'getSheet':

				# Params for row reading
				rowAsHeader     = params.get("rowAsHeader", False)
				sheetName       = params.get("sheetName", "Sheet1")
				headerRowIndex  = params.get("headerRowIndex", 1)
				startRow        = params.get("startRow", 2)
				endRow          = params.get("endRow", None)

				rows = self.getSheet(rootPath, docId, rowAsHeader, sheetName, headerRowIndex, startRow, endRow)
				
				# Update table data
				table.props.data = rows

				# Automatically create columns using the key order of the first row
				if rows:
					firstRow = rows[0]  # Ordered dict from getSheet
					cols = []

					# Use keys in the exact order produced by getSheet
					for key in firstRow.keys():
						cols.append(self.getDefaultTableColumn(key, key))
					table.props.columns = cols

				# Signal sheet data load complete
				counterIdx = 0
				self.view.custom.counters[counterIdx] = 0
				self.view.custom.sheetUpdated = True

			# ==================================================================
			# 3) append: Append dict-based rows (from UI or stored data)
			# ==================================================================
			elif methodType == 'append':

				# Developer note:
				# append_dict_rows() must be fed header/data; here it's assumed
				# your function returns the final updated rows.
				table.props.data = sheets.append_dict_rows()

				self.view.custom.docUpdated = True

			# ==================================================================
			# 4) Invalid method
			# ==================================================================
			else:
				self.view.custom.docUpdated = True
				raise Exception("Method Unavailable")

		# ----------------------------------------------------------------------
		# Missing rootPath or docId → set default docData and raise error
		# ----------------------------------------------------------------------
		else:
			self.view.custom.docData = self.getDefaultDocData()
			self.view.custom.docUpdated = True
			self.view.custom.sheetUpdated = True
			counterIdx = 0
			self.view.custom.counters[counterIdx] = 0
			raise Exception("rootTagPath, docId is necessary")

	# --------------------------------------------------------------------------
	# Exception Handling
	# --------------------------------------------------------------------------
	except Exception as e:
		# Print to Perspective output console
		system.perspective.print(u"%s" % e)

		# Reset the UI to default state on error
		self.view.custom.docData = self.getDefaultDocData()
		self.view.custom.docUpdated = True
		self.view.custom.sheetUpdated = True
		
		# Signal sheet data load complete
		counterIdx = 0
		self.view.custom.counters[counterIdx] = 0
